required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Transplantation of Adult Salivary Gland Stem Cells to Restore Submandibular Gland Function After Radiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a phase I safety and feasibility study to treat head and neck cancer patients with autologous salivary gland stem cell transplantation after postoperative radiotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data for assessing safety will be recorded from day 1 to 365.
primary_outcome.description: The number of adverse events (AE), serious adverse events (SAE) or suspected unexpected adverse reactions (SUSAR) after autologous salivary stem cell transplantation. All possible adverse events will be scored according to the definitions of the Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events version 4.0 (CTCAEv4.0).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data for assessing feasibility will be recorded 6 months after autologous stem cell transplantation to assess if salivary flow will be increased compared to salivary flow before transplantation.
primary_outcome.description: The salivary flow rate of the remaining submandibular gland will be recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data for assessing feasibility will be recorded 12 months after autologous stem cell transplantation to assess if salivary flow will be increased compared to salivary flow before transplantation.
primary_outcome.description: The salivary flow rate of the remaining submandibular gland will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Saliva measurements at 6 and 12 months and then on a yearly basis until 5 years after postoperative (chemo)radiation
secondary_outcome.description: Unstimulated whole saliva, paraffin stimulated whole saliva and 5% citric acid stimulated parotid and submandibular/sublingual saliva measurements.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient-rated outcome measures at 6 and 12 months and then on a yearly basis until 5 years after postoperative (chemo)radiation
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-rated outcome measures including various side effects related to the postoperative (chemo)radiation and Quality of Life (QoL) using internationally validated questionnaires.

Locoregional control is defined as the number of patients with recurrent disease within or adjacent to the primary tumor site and regional lymph nodes after postoperative (chemo)radiation, assessed by pathology and/or oncologic imaging (CT, MRI or PET).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of water diffusion in remaining submandibular gland
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of water diffusion in remaining submandibular gland derived from DWI/DTI-MRI.
The amount of prostate specific membrane antigen (PSMA) in the remaining submandibular gland derived from PET-CT at 6 and 12 months after autologous stem cell transplantation.

intervention.description: Autologous transplantation of salivary stem cells (salisphere derived cells) cultured in vitro as obtained from submandibular glands after postoperative radiotherapy
